title: Recognize Inline Functions
text: Add inline functions to scopetransform. Example: await new Promise(done => {process.onexit.subscribe(() => { done(); }));

title: Properly define variables
text:
Add defines for variables with a scope.__ call to a registrar function. 
For all variables

title: Complete AVM Proxy
text:
Add the ability to enumerate properties in the AVM-VM. 
Add the ability to set values in the AVM-VM.
Add support for Promises.

title: TypeScript
text: Move to TypeScript.

title: application main
text:
move applications to main() {} function
load main.js first
then load all other js files
then call main() {}

title: Startup Services
text: add c/windows/system32/services.exe which will run all registered services

title: <!DOCTYPE html>
text: Move from Quriks mode to Standards to end up with <!DOCTYPE html>

title: Add support for function
text: Add [async] function(a, b, c) {} support to scopetransform

title: Add path
text: Add the ability to add custom path values

title: Dirray
text: Move from ray to dirrays to improve boot speed

title: async all fs access
text:
Make every fs access return a Promise
- FTP and other remote access methods require this
- Access prompts will require this too

title: Registerables
text:
Add registerables. Add the ability for applications to register data to named hubs

Example usage:
netshell.exe registers itself as "add-remote-location"
explorer.exe reads "add-remote-location" services and displays the programs accordingly

title: Add Google Drive storage provider
text: Add storage provider which links to a google drive

All files will be automatically parsed and inserted

title: .dll Meta/Resources
text: Convert .dll/.dll.js to .dll folders containing meta, resources and submodules. Similar to .exe folders. fs.isExecuteable() of any dll will return true

title: .exe Meta/Resources
text: Convert .exe.js files to folders containing meta information, resources, dlls & program code. Meta contains associated file exts, author, version requirements, dll dependencies, icon

Management.device.mobile

Open windows in Fullscreen in small sizes
